title: 103_s80
content: The Act may be referred to as the "Big Thicket National Preserve Addition Act of 1993" and includes additions to the Big Thicket National Preserve. The Act, known as the "Big Thicket National Preserve Addition Act of 1993," amends subsection (b) by updating the map of the Big Thicket National Preserve to one dated October 1992. The new map will be available for public inspection in designated offices. The Secretary of the Interior may make minor revisions to the boundaries of the preserve as needed by publishing a revised drawing in the Federal Register. Changes include adjustments to the Little Pine Island-Pine Island Bayou corridor unit and the Lance Rosier unit. Additionally, new units like the Village Creek Corridor unit and the Big Sandy Corridor unit in Texas are added to the preserve. The Secretary is authorized to acquire lands within the preserve through donation, purchase, transfer, or exchange. Privately owned lands in specific units may only be acquired with owner consent. The Secretary may acquire lands within the preserve through donation, purchase, transfer, or exchange, with the consent of the owner. Lands owned by commercial timber companies can only be acquired by donation or exchange. The Secretary and the Secretary of Agriculture will identify lands for exchange within sixty days, focusing on National Forest lands near commercial timber company-owned private lands. The Secretary and the Secretary of Agriculture have the authority to exchange National Forest lands with timber companies, ensuring equal value exchanges within two years. Additionally, a specific thirty-seven-acre area owned by Louisiana-Pacific Corporation or its subsidiary in Hardin County, Texas, is also subject to potential exchange. The Secretary must obtain consent from the owner before acquiring an area currently used as a youth camp in Hardin County, Texas. A detailed boundary description of the Village Creek Corridor unit, Big Sandy Corridor unit, and Canyonlands unit of the Big Thicket National Preserve must be published in the Federal Register within six months. Appropriations are authorized for the purposes of the mentioned units. The curr_chunk is about the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States, who also serves as the President of the Senate.
